Read more Follow @mlwestphal Skip to content Parisian-themed cafe open in Loves Park Posted on June 21, 2010 at 2:23 pm by Melissa Westphal Tweet
The new Parisian-themed Rue la Paris Cafe opened for business today.
The cafe shares building space with several other local businesses including Dahlgren Johnson Kitchen and Bath and Canyon Flooring at 4001 N. Perryville Road in Loves Park, at the northeast corner of Riverside Boulevard and Perryville Road. It’s located in Suite D.
Royal Crown Events runs the restaurant, and the catering company itself just started in September. Royal Crown is the exclusive caterer for the Coronado Performing Arts Center and purchased the former River District Catering business.
Vanessa Larsen, Royal Crown’s executive event coordinator, said a restaurant was always in the original business plan for the company. She said the group is excited to get the cafe open and customers through the doors.
Royal Crown’s administrative breakdown is as follows: Rich Hilliard, owner; Dejan Vucic, corporate chef; Jason Wheeler, executive catering chef.
The cafe’s breakfast menu features light pastries and fresh fruit, while lunch features paninis, sweet and savory crepes and salads. The dinner menu features cold and hot appetizers like gourmet cheeses and stuffed mushrooms and entree selections with a European focus like grilled seafood, filet mignon with savory truffle potatoes and pasta carbonara. Several types of wine also are included on the menu.
The decor inside the cafe is designed to look like the outside streets of Paris. There is some outdoor patio space.
Hours are 9 a.m. to midnight Monday through Thursday, 9 a.m. to 2 a.m. Friday and 4 p.m. to 2 a.m. Saturday. The cafe is closed on Sundays but is available for private rental for events like bridal showers, wine tastings, etc.
Patrons can access the cafe easiest by turning on McFarland Road off Riverside and then making the first left on Back Street. Drive around the parking lot, and the cafe entrance faces Perryville.
Call 815-654-2900 for more information or to place call-ahead reservations for tables. Reservations are not required, though.
